alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Franklin; Mercer; Shelby; Woodford (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 2:27AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Shelby, north central Mercer, central Woodford, Anderson and southwestern Franklin Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 227 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Frankfort, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawrenceburg and Versailles. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
